overview: New insight into the fundamental nature of matter and the potential building blocks of the Universe
Further development of John Dalton's theory of matter, which helps address diatomic nature of gases
A crude but fascinating new theory on a new nature of transport. Currently of little use but may very easily advance into a major area of interest in the future

A major advance on the earlier prototype, the Rocket can achieve higher speeds of travel and can move greater amounts of cargo. A few extra funds and it may well be one of the most influential new areas of business and transportation.
The preheating of air entering a blast furnace. Will drastically reduce consumption of fuel and increase effiency of furnaces.
A massive nationwide railway connection, connecting London to the Midlands and spreading across the South West of England
Improved methods of communication
Faster and more efficient of communication, a replacement for the telegraph
Alternate design for hot air balloons, a possible future name being the "airship"
Not available for cross-country travel, but does reduce crowds in upper city levels and enabe greater tourist attraction
A new introduction to electricity and magnetism in general, characterised by the effect the fields have on a needle of a compass
Electromagnetic Induction found to be the foundation for electrical generators, which will allow the introduction of electricity to industry and society
Links light, magnetic and electric fields into a single phenomenon, and describes their interaction and motion in experimental physics.
Correctly distributes the known elements into categories of atomic mass and composition, and predicts the presence of additional unknown elements
Improved accuracy of shells and removal of dangerous materials
Replacing the wooden exteriors of warships with iron and steel have made them virtually impenetrable to modern artillery fire.
Though it may appear to be only for warfare, this simple item also exhibits use in mining, though the same risks still apply
Shows tremendous potential in pistons, turbines and motors and may further advance mass production rates in factories
Where there were previously five different gauges across England railways, there is now one national gauge.
Through careful experimentation, additional properties of longitudinal waves have been discovered, such as compression of wavelength with added velocity
With the advancements in telescopes, a new body in the Solar System has been found
